channel.title: How to Use Proxies In Firefox!
channel.description:
[center][b][size=15pt]How to Use Proxies In Firefox![/size][/b][/center]
First take a look at these proxy lists and pick a proxy you like that is close to where you live. [url=http://www.samair.ru/proxy/]Proxy List #1[/url] [url=http://www.atomintersoft.com/products/alive-proxy/proxy-list/]Proxy List #2[/url] [url=http://www.publicproxyservers.com/page1.html]Proxy List #3[/url]
After you find a proxy, copy it, and follow the rest of the tutorial. For this tutorial, I'll be using this proxy: 207.97.160.34:8080
In Firefox click on Tools > Options and click on the General tab. Then click on Connection Settings and this window should come up. [img]http://img212.imageshack.us/img212/1171/connectionsettingsinfirefoxnc0.png[/img]
Tick the checkbox "Manual Proxy Configuration" then for the HTTP Proxy put in the IP and where it says the port, just put in the port. Such as the proxy I picked out. The IP would be 207.97.160.34 and the port would be 8080. Understand? :)
Now tick the checkbox "Use this Proxy for all Protocols" and for the "No Proxy for" textarea, put in 192.168.1.1 since that is your modem/router and you don't need a proxy for that. :P
Here is what my settings look like: [img]http://img84.imageshack.us/img84/4199/connectionsettingsinfirefox2ww5.png[/img]
Alright, looks like you got your own anonymous proxy! Now to test it out, press OK and exit out of Firefox. Now bring it back up, and go to www.google.com or something and test out the speed and if any errors come. I have tried many proxies and soo many have speed issues or some errors come up. That will probably be the hardest part, finding the proxy. :rolleyes:
Try the proxy I used for this tutorial, it's pretty good.
Hope you learnt how to use proxies in Firefox. You need this, or pesky Big Brother will be looking over your shoulder. Which they are already unless you have one. :P
~Ron

large amount of proxies dont work. and also you should try and use ff with ie, using ie as the direct connection proxy list getter, and using ff as the proxy tester.

item.title: How to Use Proxies In Firefox!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Painless:

Ok, been trying this for a while but everytime I get the same Problem as exps. I change it to proxies. My IP is still the same. I check tools and everything and it’s still the same. When I close that FireFox and open a new the IP is still the same but when I got to tools it’s got Direct Connection to the Internet checked.

That is the strangest thing. You guys should post on this forum: http://forums.tweaks.com

They are very helpful and know much about computers!

Read full topic

@Ron wrote:

CoolCat:

I used a proxie in Iran and went on google and the page was screw’d I couldn’t read. -_-

Yeah I had that problem with the software Hide IP Platinum and every time I changed the IP, it would be in some Asian country or in Russia or in the Middle East lol.

Then when I went to Google, it was all messed up. :rolleyes: I wish google would fix that, or let you go back to the original page.

item.title: How to Use Proxies In Firefox!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

exps, did you set it up right? Have you tried more than one proxy? Next time, compare your dns IP to your new IP when you go to whatismyip.com or whatever. Because a lot of the time, your router sets a new IP for you, same with your firewall.

To get your REAL IP, right click on your conection icon on the bottom right, and click on Status. Then click on the Support tab and look at the IP address and compare it with whatismyip.com before and after the proxy.

~Ron

Read full topic

item.title: How to Use Proxies In Firefox!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[center][size=15pt]How to Use Proxies In Firefox![/size][/center]

First take a look at these proxy lists and pick a proxy you like that is close to where you live.
Proxy List #1
Proxy List #2
Proxy List #3

After you find a proxy, copy it, and follow the rest of the tutorial. For this tutorial, I’ll be using this proxy: 207.97.160.34:8080

In Firefox click on Tools > Options and click on the General tab. Then click on Connection Settings and this window should come up.

Tick the checkbox “Manual Proxy Configuration” then for the HTTP Proxy put in the IP and where it says the port, just put in the port. Such as the proxy I picked out. The IP would be 207.97.160.34 and the port would be 8080. Understand?

Now tick the checkbox “Use this Proxy for all Protocols” and for the “No Proxy for” textarea, put in 192.168.1.1 since that is your modem/router and you don’t need a proxy for that.

Here is what my settings look like:

Alright, looks like you got your own anonymous proxy! Now to test it out, press OK and exit out of Firefox. Now bring it back up, and go to www.google.com or something and test out the speed and if any errors come. I have tried many proxies and soo many have speed issues or some errors come up. That will probably be the hardest part, finding the proxy. :rolleyes:

Try the proxy I used for this tutorial, it’s pretty good.

Hope you learnt how to use proxies in Firefox. You need this, or pesky Big Brother will be looking over your shoulder. Which they are already unless you have one.

~Ron
